newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish GNP up by 7.9 pct in 1996,.
newsitem.headline: Turkish GNP up by 7.9 pct in 1996,.

text.p: Turkish Gross National Product showed a rise of 7.9 percent in 1996, the state institute of statistics announced in Monday.
The institute said in a statement that fourth quarter 1996 GNP was up by 8.8 percent compared to the same period in 1995 and per capita income increased by 6.1 percent to $2,928.
The Gross Domestic Product increase in 1996 was 7.2 percent, according to the statement.
The market had expected the GNP rise to be between 7.5 and eight percent.
The figures compare with a GNP increase in 1995 of eight percent and a fourth quarter 1995 increase of eight percent.
The growth in the agriculture sector for 1996 was 5.2, industry grew by 7.1, construction 4.8, trade 8.7 and the transport sector by 7.9 percent, the statement said.
